alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cheshire County through 545 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Richmond, or 9 miles west of Jaffrey, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jaffrey, Swanzey, Winchester, Dublin, Richmond, Harrisville, Marlborough, Rindge, Fitzwilliam and Troy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
